channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Cameraman Tim Myers was hit with a riot shield and punched in the face, while reporter Amelia Brace was clubbed with a truncheon outside the White House as police made way for President Trump.
item.title: US Ambassador responds to assault of Australian journalists by police outside White House

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 3, 2020

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash with police.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Donald Trump threatens US military intervention as autopsy reveals Floyd's cause of death was 'asphyxiation from applied pressure'

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: A couple with almost $4 million in financial assets could still be eligible for a health card and all the benefits that go with it.
item.title: New deeming rates open more access to CSHC

item.description: The dividend party for the Big Four appears over as their profitability and outlook are seen as in decline.
item.title: Is your portfolio too heavily weighted to bank shares?

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Mandatory drawdown rates have been halved for the current financial year and the next one because of the pandemic-induced economic downturn.
item.title: Move to pension mode has benefits in COVID-19 climate

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The challenge is to have enough personalisation in a retirement strategy that supports the lifestyle needs of the person.
item.title: COVID-19 shows super is failing older Australians

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Borrowing money has never been cheaper but there is a glaring exception to the almost universal plunge in interest rates.
item.title: Ultra-cheap money but not on your credit card

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: The prudential regulator says some superannuation funds are facing sustainability challenges and should shape up or move out of the industry.
item.title: Time to check your super fund returns

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Government handouts to buy new builds should not blind buyers from additional risks of buying new over established properties.
item.title: Cash grants likely in 'buy-new' home incentive

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: NSW lifts COVID-19 restrictions on gyms, junior sport; Palaszczuk issues apology over Nathan Turner death as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Jonathan Brown and Simon Black - both triple-premiership players for the Brisbane Lions - have become members of the Australian Football Hall of Fame.
item.title: Brown and Black: shades of brilliance

item.description: And a bastard of a football theory.
item.title: Premiers in a sartorial state

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Cities around the world are letting eateries turn their streets, car parks, footpaths, squares and parks into open-air cafes to increase their patronage while observing COVID-19 social distancing restrictions.
item.title: Could we save Melbourne's restaurants by allowing them to use public spaces?

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The state government has announced a July 1 sport restart date for under-18s but has not provided a schedule for senior competitions.
item.title: 'No understanding': Community sports blast government plan on return dates

item.description: Formula One will finally get underway with back-to-back races at the Austrian Grand Prix in July as part of an eight-race European swing.
item.title: Revised Formula One calendar gets green light

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Cronulla winger Ronaldo Mulitalo said Andrew Fifita and Josh Dugan were key figures in encouraging players to enrol in the course to help their mental wellbeing.
item.title: Young Sharks find peace in social-work course amid Cronulla chaos

item.description: The father of a girl hoping to become Britain's youngest Olympian says doctors feared for his daughter's life after her "gnarliest fall" yet.
item.title: 'Don't worry, I'm OK': Olympic skateboarding hope, 11, fractures skull

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: The two-time Norm Smith medallist and 340-gamer at the Crows has voiced his unrest in a podcast, where he claimed several of his old teammates feel the same way.
item.title: McLeod doesn't feel welcome at Crows

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland managed to avoid alarming coronavirus predictions.
item.title: ICUs were braced to ventilate enough people to fill Suncorp Stadium

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A world-first operation at Brisbane's PA Hospital is allowing Brodie Ellis to regrow parts of his own skull, helping him recover from serious injuries.
item.title: Brisbane man regrows skull in world-first procedure

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The Electoral Commission of Queensland's vote count website gave barely any results on election night, frustrating many.
item.title: Inquiry slams ECQ for slow council election results

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: As armed soldiers patrol the streets, the unease of a 70-day pandemic lockdown in Los Angeles has given way to fear of what comes next.
item.title: Sleepless in Los Angeles as cries for injustice turn into a terrifying chorus

item.description: Two Western Australian cousins who were forensically linked to a suitcase stuffed full of ill-gotten cash found at Sydney Airport have been handed extra jail time.
item.title: WA cousins linked to suitcase full of ill-gotten cash found at Sydney Airport jailed

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Adam Clune has been brought in on minimum wage to save the Dragons and their $2m star halves - and those close to him say he was ready for the NRL last year.
item.title: Send in the Clune: 'Outstanding' debutant tipped to spark misfiring Dragons

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Western United and Macarthur FC, the A-League's 11th and 12th teams, are the subject of seperate actions in the Federal Circuit Court.
item.title: A-League expansion clubs taken to court by former employees

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: Child rape charges have been dropped against male members of the infamous Colt family before the men were due to face trial.
item.title: NSW prosecutors drop child rape charges in Colt incest family case

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: "Realigning ourselves in the world, changing that relationship with China, it's not a cost-free thing to do, I'm being very honest about that," Farage said.
item.title: Farage wants tougher stance on China, says Trump needed to 'stop it'

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The state opposition has lashed child safety minister Di Farmer and the state government over the death of the Caboolture toddler.
item.title: 'Hang their heads in shame': No sackings after Mason Lee death

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Marilyn Figueroa says those protesting against the death of George Floyd have been treated much more harshly than armed demonstrators at anti-lockdown rallies.
item.title: 'People were panicked and tripping over': DC protesters fear worse to come

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: State bushfire-fighting efforts are being frustrated by the lack of an overarching national system to decide where firefighters, water-bombing aircraft and other resources are deployed during emergencies, the bushfire royal commission has heard.
item.title: Lack of 'national picture' hampering bushfire-fighting efforts

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Cricket Australia can expect another fight with its players if its financial projections for the coming summer are lower than expected.
item.title: Pay day: Cricketers set to fight if CA projections are not 'reasonable'

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: America's biggest cities have again descended into vandalism as governors condemn Trump's threat to unleash the US military to restore law and order.
item.title: Riots flare in New York, Washington and LA as Trump threatens to deploy military

item.description: Raid on Timothy Moran's Eltham home uncovered array of DIY firearms, two pipe bombs, ammunition, a nunchaku, machete, a dead cannabis plant and a bag of weed.
item.title: Drug grower jailed after makeshift gun factory found at his home

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Victoria Cross recipient was involved in two more unlawful deaths in Afghanistan in 2012, fresh witness statements allege.
item.title: Ben Roberts-Smith involved in seven unlawful killings, new witness statements allege

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The battle for Virgin has come down to a clash of two titans: the Bostonians from Bain versus the late contender from Wall Street, Cyrus. Both have Richard Branson in common.
item.title: Forget Team Australia, Virgin will ultimately be owned by Americans

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The state's building watchdog suspended the licence of engineering arm of corporate giant Lendlease, but the company says the licence is not needed.
item.title: Lendlease Engineering has building licence suspended by QBCC

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Barilaro, who has been a strong ally for the game in recent months, said July 1 was too soon for real crowds to return.
item.title: Tighter screening process for Fan in the Stand as Barilaro shuts down V'landys on crowds

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Conservative crossbenchers have joined Labor and the Greens to defeat the Berejiklian government's wages policy in the upper house.
item.title: Berejiklian government's push to freeze public servant wages blocked

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The state government insists it won’t be rushed into a decision about a return to play timeline for local football despite pressure from AFL Victoria.
item.title: Health must be top priority, minister tells impatient AFL Victoria

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The return of the former Victorian president of the Comancheros, Amad 'Jay' Malkoun, is expected to inflame tensions with his successor and between rival gangs.
item.title: Ex-bikie boss' return to Melbourne set to inflame tensions

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The government-owned wholesale broadband provider has been taken to task by the competition regulator for giving TransACT customers a bum steer.
item.title: NBN misled customers in Canberra on network switch

item.description: The former Dally M Medallist played through pain in the second half of the Cowboys win over the Gold Coast and scans have revealed some bone bruising.
item.title: Huge blow for Cowboys as Taumalolo ruled out of Sharks clash

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Theatre companies welcome the prospect of a targeted live performance rescue package, but say they can't reopen under current social distancing rules.
item.title: 'Let us open our theatres,' companies ask government
